peregrine.sort
Interface SortComparator

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Comparator<StructReader>
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultSortComparator, RankMetadataByIndegreeComparator, RankMetadataByRankSortComparator, StrictSortComparator, StrictSortDescendingComparator
public interface SortComparator
extends java.util.Comparator<StructReader>

Used by clients which require custom sorting. This allows us to sort by fields in the value or in the key.

When using a value which is NOT globally unique the key should also be specified which would make it unique.

Specified by:
compare in interface java.util.Comparator<StructReader>

getSortKey

StructReader getSortKey(StructReader key,
                        StructReader value)

Given a key and value, compute a sort key.

A sort key is a key used to globally sort an entry in the a sort job. This is the main column (or columns) from the value you want to sort combined with the hashcode/key that identifies that item.

The hashcode is required for pathological cases where all the values are identical so that we have globally unique keys for everything.
